content.description:
Pooh's Arete - 5.10a *** (65') F(5b)

A hard bouldery start at the bottom of the obvious (sharp) arete, leads back and forth, side to side, to the chain anchors at the top. Great rock, great holds, great location and great variety of moves.
content.protection: All bolts to the chain anchors.
content.location: The obvious sharp arete at the bottom of the lower right end of the crag.

content.description:
Mu - 5.10b *** (65') F (6b)

Begin about 5' up and left of the start of Bear Necessities and climb directly up excellent rock to the chain anchors over the top. The tricky crux is getting past the bulge above the small Service Berry tree (bolts 2 to 4).
content.location: On the left end of the face left of the prominent arete.

content.description:
Bear Necessities - 5.8 *** (70') M (4b)

Climb the middle of the face left of the arete, beginning about 20' up from the start of the arete. Excellent rock and moves (some gear protected with medium nuts in the excellent finger crack) lead to the top of the crack, from there step left 5' to join "Mu" for the top 15' to the chain anchors just over the top.
content.protection: Mixed - 4 bolt plus medium nuts or cams.
